message: What is the Ubuntu edition do you recommend for me if I want to use it for development purposes ?

data.message:
Ubuntu Gnome 14.04
Unity doesn't make sense at all. Gnome is very much like a desktop. It has the best features from Mac and Windows. And extensions are great.
I used Ubuntu 14.04 for a while then switched to elementary os Luna, and I am learning Ruby on Rails as well as some front end development.

Amr Eldib Is there a much difference between it and the edition available @ Ubuntu website ?

Amr Tag Why did you switched ? Can you share with us your experience ?
Elementary OS is based upon Ubuntu, so major functionalities are still there. I really loved their UI and design of things more than Ubuntu.
In general, LTS (long term support) versions of ubuntu are recommended
Elementary is built upon ubuntu 14.04 LTS, plus, we are not corporations, we can do the 6 months cycle of upgrades for the cool features.
Linux Mint is worth considering, also Kubuntu if or Linux Mint KDE if you like KDE.
